text: The Afar language () (also known as â€™Afar Af, Afaraf, Qafar af) is a lowland East Cushitic language spoken by the Afar people in Ethiopia, Eritrea and Djibouti. It is thought to have 1.5 million speakers. Its most similar language is the Saho language.Raymond G. Gordon, Jr, ed. 2005. Ethnologue: Languages of the World. 15th edition. Dallas: Summer Institute of Linguistics. == References == Category:Cushitic languages Category:Languages of Djibouti Category:Languages of Eritrea Category:Languages of Ethiopia
title: Afar language
